title: 1970s Australian TV miniature
credit_line: Designed by Graham McGuffie, Emily Boutard and Megafun
brief_description: This gorgeous model miniature celebrates the screen stories Australians loved during the 1970s.

constellations_primary.name: 1970s TV
constellations_primary.description: The 1970s was a thrilling time in Australian television as productions expanded in scale, scope, and ambition.

description: David Bowie. Madonna. ABBA. Kylie Minogue. If you were a music act in the 1970s, there was one show you had to be on to solidify your status and that was Countdown. Hosted by Ian ‘Molly’ Meldrum, the ABC program became an institution during its 13-year run. It was the shining jewel in the crown of Australian TV, which moved to exciting new places in the 70s with the arrival of colour. Channel 10 had the saucy Number 96, comedy found new footing with The Aunty Jack Show and the Special Broadcast Service (SBS) was officially launched in 1979 with the aim of telling multicultural Australian stories.
